21F05E4E207D4061BE7D7B7F785B977A.description: Examine the role of music in expressing Indigenous cultural and individual identity, past and present (e.g., treaty education outcome SI10: Analyze the spirit and intent of treaties and investigate the extent to which they have been fulfilled).

DD31635CDB8E4C5EA32FD94FFDA56F04.description: Examine connections between spirituality and music across diverse cultures and traditions, for example: religious patrons, music commissions, music in ritual and ceremony and cultural storytelling.

F960ADAD61C445F1A4A59C360CE67345.description: Engage with First Nations and Métis musicians (e.g., in person or online) to investigate how instrumental music is taught, learned, created and performed.

19797C49D6D04200B10FA0859BE83507.description: Investigate protocols and traditional/natural laws related to creating and performing instrumental music (e.g., gifting of music, issues surrounding cultural appropriation).

820E023FBF094C21B4238223FE5007CB.description: Research and engage with Elders and local musicians and composers to learn about traditional instrumental music and Indigenous ways of knowing.

10353BD9282B49DD91DD6BA003541617.description: Generate inquiry questions to examine the meaning of “ways of knowing” such as: What are some cultural ways of knowing? and What are some subject area or discipline-based ways of knowing (e.g., scientific ways of knowing, artistic ways of knowing)?

D3F84289FC8E4016A0979734CEB51C2E.description: Research and discuss First Nations and Métis traditional cultural methods of teaching, learning, creating and performing instrumental music.

CBC70A274596407CB4C4D19C63CC8B11.description: Discuss criteria used in the process of designing a well-rounded concert program, considering diversity, focus and quality of repertoire selected.

108D2E3F66BB424781B305F5885B9C31.description: Examine and play repertoire that utilizes a variety of compositional techniques and devices.

70D410EC1E3C49EEB5A2BA5D9D4BDF51.description: Examine and play a range of repertoire (e.g., traditional wind band, composers of diverse genders, Indigenous, self- published, young composers, variety of genres and styles).

8A27DDEC482E451381C0A8D4DB22FD3C.description: Discuss characteristics of high quality repertoire.

6616B09646564F21A8E5CF82778A1295.description: Identify characteristics of high quality repertoire.

F8B8CFE3F8674E678D2D0819F916BC5C.description: Connect composers’ personal experiences to the literature where appropriate (e.g., What inspired this composer to write this piece?).

E9B0AD6114184D44A9CC0338303ADF06.description: Study and/or perform wind band works composed by living composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

A8A2598FB0FD496C91F99267EA864E4E.description: Listen to, and perhaps perform, selected pieces from Canadian and international music literature including historically under-represented composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

E1A5B591A52949A09C46BD7181283770.description: Explore a variety of Canadian and international music literature.

823433DD60D846FEBC0E3F6BB3F4C60C.description: Explore how evolving technology and media have influenced and changed how music is created, produced, distributed and shared (e.g., instrument evolution, recording, printing press, online music sites).

AA74C1BE1A9B427DAA6CF0F464B5A768.description: Examine issues of appropriation in music

F98BA91CCE4048A88E85DC3028428979.description: Describe the background of the composer.

046411CD7C4648139DFE0CB6968574E4.description: Identify relevant world events, views and cultural contexts that enhance understanding of the repertoire.

476DE26C1A4643D4A7EC3C0463E672BD.description: Explore the purpose and intent of the piece and apply this learning to own interpretation.

ADFDF8DA8E5E41DA9D32C3D8DA7298E8.description: Discuss musical elements that indicate the music’s context (e.g., instrumentation, style, cultural background).

FE9CC97A650E43D59BA8AE4996ED8DA1.description: Discuss the historical, cultural and social contexts of repertoire.

DA5D7C3045074869BEF85AD3ED152591.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

4018E2DC5ECC4BFE80FE770B560F4756.description: Apply attained knowledge to improve personal and ensemble performance.

79058B6BDE1C493CB8DB106D369F2887.description: Critique performance of others and provide feedback (e.g., what is going well, what could be improved) using appropriate musical terminology.

EB1F1EC68CE04C29A13372224A792F2E.description: Co-create a list of specific criteria to use in assessing performances.

A55B06C5FBBC4836832314FD246FF056.description: Listen and respond, with teacher guidance, to musical expressions of self and others, conducting critical analysis using musical terminology.

644878B110C640A0985980FD77D27285.description: Recognize the value of music as a life-long source of enjoyment and personal fulfilment.

9F8630D64D4044749152C0B117E74007.description: Broaden musical experience and interests through active participation (e.g., trying different instruments, attending concerts, attending powwows).

1FEF5DAACD0D47FCABF9F4FB4F61E8AA.description: Extend understanding of First Nations and Métis music and cultures through dialogue with local Elders or Knowledge Keepers.

929720FB5B5E4E34B4E2F618FF99448C.description: Engage with local, Saskatchewan and Canadian musicians, including Indigenous musicians, to expand learning opportunities.

B22F5C3A2DF040C7A66F3AE9B56372B3.description: Discuss how music impacts own daily life (e.g., ceremony, film, gym).

60F4713715104A0A87C50097108A3109.description: Examine the impact and role of music in societies (e.g., powwows, religious services, social gatherings).

955B63EE5E7A41AB9445843E85294452.description: Investigate the impact and role of music in own life.

B2F37A7839184C5D9997B8A248AEC4B0.description: Describe the development of personal musical skills and knowledge.

BAAA916022124495ABB2279EEB52DDCB.description: Explore various solutions to common musical challenges and goals.

49626A78E4924E5EB235F3093B0ABFFB.description: Identify main areas of focus for musical growth.

58EBCD0E79C04434BF60A8AFCD35AF7B.description: Reflect on the input of others (e.g., peers, teacher, adjudicator).

76D238011C484289B945EDE4E955F2D4.description: Examine own musical expressions, in real time and/or using recording technology, in order to improve through critical self-reflection (e.g., create inquiry questions such as What can I do to get better? How could I change this performance, arrangement or composition?).

D7F8E7075E034E80A3F4815D3319E936.description: Incorporate, with teacher guidance, constructive criticism and reflection on personal and group performance

7F5DF305498E4A2B9F30A305FAA5F444.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry

314956FF554244CBA464E2172187D023.description: Demonstrate leadership as a performer by modelling and/or offering assistance and ideas during rehearsal/practice.

DD980965EAF64462B742F9FF17C640B0.description: Employ rehearsal techniques (e.g., making notes, respectfully providing and applying feedback, making and trying out musical decisions).

B20E89CF6C204D12A46BD365CE938E97.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the skills, attitudes and techniques necessary for ensemble performance.

58EA195E982D4E7FABDFE35308EE361D.description: Play in tune with good balance and tone.

F573EDEA32FE4E10BEB73DA59E9A263B.description: Individually attend to melodic phrasing, rhythmic accuracy and articulation in the preparation and performance of music.

E385B0058F874579B48B928142D2315D.description: Demonstrate the ability to perform the specific tasks particular to the instrument within the ensemble.

80F1C975DD254E468F173BB3E2E0B490.description: Identify the function/role of sections within an ensemble.

56EE2156E0B64CA1B3D8207180A247FF.description: Demonstrate foundational skills, practices and techniques accurately and consistently during ensemble rehearsal and performance.

386BCF2F64AC4DD495AD4E8F2DA55033.description: Use technology (e.g., recording or notation) to generate or complement musical material.

08A9111C96554C018899E2B99E165566.description: Discuss legal and ethical arts practices when composing or arranging (e.g., copyright, plagiarism).

AAB3AA89613543A599C5C5B6F14BE06A.description: Compose a short melody or riff (e.g., written, improvised).

CD8DE7BCCE224177A007429B6DC2B6B0.description: Experiment with improvisation (e.g., call and response).

3B9F929610824F51BA0702931D5B3F24.description: Experiment with diverse music elements, techniques, tools, language and practices.

D89B32E29F914ED5BB225A832D4447FD.description: Experiment with the manipulation and organization of pre-existing musical material on or for band instruments.

6AE8B82D037541138B79C1E8B4AA6C82.description: Identify and describe the differences in musical and non-musical performances.

E66A08E5640744E5A116761F0D2D47F4.description: Identify composer’s, performers’ and own intent for the piece.

A3254048B3DC42949AE6CFD2AC9E1DB5.description: Discuss with teacher the intention of the piece.

FD640AB0F9EF41EEBBF0BC4A8C75A468.description: Determine the appropriate performance practice for the style of a given piece of music.

CB1809712A364A799BDBFD2CBC776904.description: Identify the points of tension and release.

1B01CEE922F744069F95470D9977DFAA.description: Demonstrate, with teacher guidance, the ability to make expressive, interpretive and creative choices to communicate music.

CEAFDB02149348F1832E4DEEE3D90106.description: Reflect on progress of music reading and writing ability.

7943C20F8AC74F3BB5B7CBF95B56D8ED.description: Represent musical ideas using standard notation.

4AD966863A464FA08F484CD63ECB3BE7.description: Use critical thinking to revise, refine and share music through notation.

672CECB5F52F47FBBABD803FDC9CEA13.description: Read and interpret, with teacher guidance, standard written musical communication.

3FCDAE406C704D4E9A5D63E400BEA307.description: Interpret and represent musical ideas in a variety of ways, including standard music notation, to expressively communicate ideas.

A60BD47EA4E143DE8613B006F6835EA1.description: Notate (e.g., traditional, non-traditional, graphic) simple melodic and rhythmic dictation accurately.

B38C4C5FA41E4434856FE7E76B0FB7CE.description: Create and reproduce musical ideas accurately using call and response utilizing more than one note.

262D687518A44DD7B384B75E959F6693.description: Discern pitch variances (e.g., tuning, pitch accuracy, intonation) and make appropriate adjustments.

565622F531874122B14AF1D5457E2F91.description: Match musical nuances such as length of note, tone colour and articulations within instrument section and full band.

68393115D50F418D907E22792B7A85D0.description: Describe and apply, with guidance, aural skills related to sectional, ensemble and personal playing.

D6EA3F568B8B4F188C1BC897491E188D.description: Play batter percussion rudiments including: single stroke roll, double stroke roll, paradiddle and multiple bounce roll.

E6F4E4F92C5E42569B51E38DA05B9D12.description: Play chromatic scales in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

42BF65F5AA9241499EB73045B3F54213.description: Play 7 major and related minor scales using multiple articulation and rhythmic patterns in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

11195FAD616E4966AB11A59B5D4B1581.description: Demonstrate fluency and proficiency in rudiments (i.e., batter percussion) and scales (i.e., wind instruments and mallet percussion) including: 7 major and related minor scales and chromatic scales.

D75258F269824D7DA5397192555028F1.description: Investigate extended techniques (e.g., vibrato where appropriate, experiment with timbral shading, multiple tonguing).

327E5F93D27442D483B7873412308D38.description: Apply accurate articulations (e.g., placement of tongue, attack and release, lengths of notes).

BF5E52CE860544DAB75D8C53C92CB49E.description: Produce resonant tone consistently within appropriate register (e.g., adapt oral cavity).

673618C22DC64D37BB6299C79D16F1DC.description: Play with correct posture and hand and instrument position.

FD2AEAFD640142E99BCBF6BD8C03C631.description: Employ efficient breathing and breath support.

3C01E201234543AD9C5F911B8C00E3D5.description: Demonstrate, with teacher guidance, proper instrumental tone and technique.

1F525CD5EB84417DAA72C04E03A67269.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art
